text: Rasipuram Krishnaswamy Laxman Pg.11 in the source says that Laxman & his brother Narayan were Tamil Iyer Brahmins. (24 October 1921 – 26 January 2015) was an Indian cartoonist, writer, illustrator, and humorist.Laxman's-eye view Frontline Magazine – 18–31 July 1998 He was best known for his creation The Common Man. It was for his daily cartoon strip, "You Said It" in The Times of India. It started in 1951. Laxman died from multiple organ failure caused by a urinary tract infection in Pune, Maharashtra, India, aged 93. ==Books by Laxman== * ==References== ==Other websites== * Laxman's-eye view Frontline Magazine – 18–31 July 1998 Category:1921 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:Deaths from urinary tract infection Category:Indian cartoonists Category:Indian writers
title: R. K. Laxman
